page.title: 14PRESTON FARMERS cont.+ LUWKA
page.content: The computer was installed in summer 1985.The main frame is at head office in Preston.Each depot has its own ter- minal linked by British Telecom.It con- trols stock-taking,order forms,delivery tickets and cash and carry sales re- ceipts.Each day all orders are passed to Preston and processed there. The system has cut down the paperwork and human error and provides rapid response to customer queries.Business is season- al following the needs of the farmer.It normally depends on farmers doing well but in 1985 the wet weather caused far- mers to buy in more feedstuffs than usual as their own fodder crops are poor. LUWKA is one of a network of long term government storage depots containing food to be available in time of nation- al crisis including nuclear war.It is situated by the Preston Farmers depot.
